comments.body: for future references, `namespace` is preferred to `module`.

Oh really... I thought it was the other way round and namespace was the old way, will do in future. 
Is namespace preferred specifically for the declare namespace 'abc' type stuff that is used for creating definitions for imports or all .d.ts files in general?

namespaces can not be used with a string (module identifier), these are modules. 

In TS 1.0 `module` meant both, external module (something you get by calling `require`), and an internal module (a named object literal to avoid namespace pollution). this was confusing.  so TS 1.6 added a new keyword `namespace` to be used for internal modules.

here are more docs about this: http://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/namespaces-and-modules.html
